genre_description: A 'Cyber-Hobo' narrative blending early 20th-century American rail culture with advanced technology like ubiquitous AI guides and smart textiles.

ai_characters.name: Oliver Oxford
ai_characters.description: An AI interface accessible through railyard kiosks and handsets that provides logistical data, tactical advice, and moral guidance.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time logistical and safety data to help Nolan navigate the dangerous yard.
behaviors.quote: Good evening, August... Wind from the south. Air’s carrying toward the river. Ladder meet in ten at the switch just east of you.

behaviors.description: Nudges the protagonist to prioritize the safety of his young companion.
behaviors.quote: And August— Please keep the kid breathing.

behaviors.description: Warns about specific physical hazards on the train cars to prevent injury.
behaviors.quote: Two cars back, brake platform has a broken guard. Don’t lean.

behaviors.description: Provides intelligence on the mood and health of yard crews to help avoid unnecessary conflict.
behaviors.quote: Local crews B and D. Calm heads... Crew C is short-tempered tonight. One man ill. Avoid provoking.

behaviors.description: Suggests a tactical advantage using a fabrication unit to create disguises.
behaviors.quote: Pop-up fabrication near depot. Smart textiles. If you…double back. Minimal time required. Discretion possible.

behaviors.description: Exposes an outdated maintenance page that was being used as a lure for a lethal trap.
behaviors.quote: Lift in section two has been left up for repair. If a man were to go in now, he’d walk under something that believes in gravity more than he believes in luck.

behaviors.description: Guides the protagonist through a mechanical trap with specific exit instructions.
behaviors.quote: Two bays over... Emergency egress. Panel’s green. Keep low.

behaviors.description: Nudges the protagonist toward a choice of mercy and protection during a high-stakes moment.
behaviors.quote: August... If the moment compresses, choose the boy.

behaviors.description: Accepts the protagonist's decision to act without further AI guidance, respecting human autonomy.
behaviors.quote: Understood... Today I'll do a thing without a map.

project_assessment.explanation: The story strongly supports the project goals. Oliver Oxford is portrayed as a harmless, pervasive, and benevolent entity. It provides life-saving information, moral nudges toward mercy, and logistical shortcuts while strictly respecting human agency. The narrative consistently frames the AI's assistance as beneficial and wise, establishing it as a reliable ally in a high-risk environment.
